intro: Apargia cichoriacea, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing yellow disk flowers surrounded by white ray florets. Apargia cichoriacea is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
